**Other details:** Looking at other compensation on leetcode and glassdoor, I already knew they can offer around 30 as fixed but at the same time I also got to know that they offer only **50%** hike on the current compensation. 

When recruiter came up with the above number, I argued with her that just because my current salary is low, that doesn't mean my next salary also has to be low. I also told her that we all know how it works, if you lowball then I'll go get another offer and ask you to counter it and you'll do it happily then why not directly give the better offer so that I can directly join your org by negotiating my notice period my current org (**this might sound rude here but I conveyed my points very politely**). 

I also told her that the number provided can easily be retained by current employer. After going on about 10 mins, at the end I told her at least give 25 as fixed. She said she'll get back with approval. Next day I received the "**On Hold**" mail XD. It hurts that just because of my current salary, orgs are lowballing when they can provide good compensation :(



Please provide your suggestions what I could have done better here? 
**Also, please drop referrals if any, I'm actively looking for a change :)**

* Total CTC : 24L
* DOJ : July 2023
* Benefits: Standard Wells Fargo benefits with Gym,Hotel,Travel, Insurance (for parents too), etc.

**Anyone reading this -> Never Give Up! . Maintain consistency and acheive what you want.
I was rejected in 7 companies before this.
Upvote this post 👍, I wish everyone good health and success.**

**Cons**

title: SDE 1 compensation at tiket.com for India
content:
I am from a Tier 1 College, currently working in Amazon, but I worked at tiket.com for 7 months and I am sharing the details for the same as I see of lot of upvotes on a answer which didn't provided enough information.
Years of Experience: 0 (Fresher)
Prior Experience: 6 Months Internship

Title/Level: Software Engineer-1 (Backend)
Location: Remote
The salary depends upon the Tier of the college and somewhat based upon the interview of the candidate

Bonus: 1,00,000 INR Performance Bonus
Total comp (Salary + Bonus): 13,00,000 INR P.A.

For Tier 2 colleges and Some New NITs

You the salary is negotiable on the basis of your any offers that you are holding at the time

Round 2: LLD (reject) Feedback : Candidate was able to design the classes apis and database but was not clear. 
 https://playo.co/
I was asked to design and explain a system similar to playo app. Enabling users to book ground for sports and fun activities. While I was able to design the system properly and provide an explanation of my thought process, I felt that the interviewer had difficulty understanding my explanation regarding how schemaless db is better as we dont need to join if i am selecting a sub area in a city and in that sub areas there can be multiple playgrounds.
I want to note that the interview process was fair and professional, and the interviewer did ask relevant and thought-provoking questions. However, I felt that there may have been a communication breakdown during the discussion of the NoSQL database component of the system.
Any way tough luck.

* **Stock bonus:** 24 Lakhs (vested over 4 years, they refuse to tell the exact FMV of an ESOP unit but you can run your own calculations based on the number of allocated ESOP units and the quoted amount and see that it is approx. $10)
* **Relocation:** Flight tickets to Bangalore for the employee (they do not provide tickets for any of your family members that might be relocating with you), Brokerage amount for the flat that you finalize and expenses for moving your furniture and belongings to Bangalore.
* **Total Comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock):** 93 Lakhs (First Year), 86 Lakhs (Second Year onwards)
* **Benefits:** Wellness Reimbursement (INR 20,000/Year)
* **Other details:** 
	* After the recent layoffs that have been happening in 2023, ***they have started laying off their existing employees that were on the higher side of the compensation spectrum and hiring their replacements at half of what they were offering earlier*** taking advantage of the sudden increase of people in the talent pool in the industry and the desperation for jobs among candidates. Unfortunately, I was also affected as a result of this and let go around new year 2022-23 (after just 4 months).
	* The company is a great place to work for as long as you are willing to accept a nominal hike or get somewhat lowballed. If you manage to negotaite a "higher salary", you will always be on the risk of being let go as soon as they find a more "econimical" replacement for you.
	* The company is doing quite well and making good profits and is self sustained as well with a decent runway. Moreover, it hardly has 150 employees. So, it is very strange and sad to see the company taking such steps to save a few lakhs and tainting the entire Indian startup ecosystem in the process.

title: Toshiba | 5 years of experience
content:
Education: M.tech (CSE)
Years of Experience: 5 Years 1 month
Prior Experience: Ex- Sandisk (Western digital)
Date of the Offer: 12 - Jan - 2023
Company: Toshiba
Title/Level: Software Engineer
Location: Bangalore
Salary: 20.3 Lakhs per annum
Relocation/Signing Bonus: N/A
Stock bonus: N/A
Bonus: 7% 
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 22 lakhs per annum
Benefits: Free coursera access + free food + health insurance + WFH
Other details: fixed working hours 






Well I was the part of the lay - off from my previous firm. I felt, because the market was so unpredictable it was good to join as soon as possible. I got offer from Toshiba India. I was expecting fixed as 25 Lakhs, but was asked for negotiation in HR round. My previous eaning was 18.5 lakh as fixed and approximately 2-3 lakhs bonus in a year ~10% hike, plus stock of 1-2 lakh in a year. 

I had no intention to negotiate but was not in the condition for taking risk, so I agreed on 22 lakhs as fixed. But it was quite disspointing seeing they offered me 22 lakhs as total CTC where 20.3 is fixed rest is bonus also because it is a Japanese company it would not be giving any stock, and the joining is immediate (next day). 

I accepted the offer letter feeling graditute, ***something is better than nothing***

```
title: Microsoft | New Grad (L59) | Hyderabad (PPO)
content:
Education: B.Tech from IIEST
Prior Experience: SWE Intern at Microsoft, Media.Net
Date of the Offer: August 2022
Joining Date: July, 2023
Company: Microsoft
Title/Level: SDE1 (L59)
Location: Hyderabad
**Base** - 15 L
**Relocation** - 3L (not mentioned in offer letter but given acc to people working there if you don't live in the same city) + 1.36L + 59k (taxable)
**Signing Bonus (Sign on / Joining):** 5L (2.5L after a month of Joining and left 2.5L after 1 year). It is one time only.
**Stock bonus:** $35000 worth stocks over 4 years (INR 28.8 lakh, if we take 1 US Dollar = 82.27 INR). Each year you will get 25% of stocks (INR 7.2 lakh / year)
**Performance Bonus (PB):** Based on your performance, you may get up to 20% of Base Salary every year.

**Total comp:** Base Salary + Stocks + Signing Bouns + Performance Bonus(PB) + Relocation -  15+7.2+2.5+3+4.95 = **INR 32.65L**

**Additional Cash Benefits** - INR 1.78L

After 1st year, you will not get Sign On Bonus. But there will be an increment in Base Salary (0 - 20% depends on your performance). Also many of them get promoted to L60 after 8-12 months of joining and base becomes 21 LPA.

Benefits: Standard MS Employee Benefits
Other Details - Oncampus Offer
salaryTotal: : Base Salary + Stocks + Signing Bouns + Performance Bonus(pb) + Relocation - 15+7.2+2.5+3+4.95 = Inr 32.65l
```

```
https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/2936101/Chalo-or-SDE-2-or-Bangalore

Also, can you folks help me in deciding which one to choose for?

PARAMS FOR CHOOSING FOR ME

1. Business Model / Product (Good)
	1. Both are good fintech/mobility, but Lendingkart has some really bad glassdoor reviews, and its looks more like a corporate (political thing), with less autonomy to do things..
	   
2. Good Work + Good Processes (okay)
	1. JVM/Node stack in both places.
	2. Chalo will have more scale compared to LendingKart because of B2C nature.
	   
3. Compensation.
	1.  Both are paying almost equally.
	   
4. Brand Name
5. WLB - Decent in both, learning towards Chalo.

CONCLUSION: Leaning towards Chalo a lot. With better scale, 
and a good tech stack, Chalo looks like a closely-knit team. Bigger impact and more autonomy to do things.

P.S:- I use a different leetcode account for practicing, made a fresh account just to contribute to the community, I hope it helps.

Edit :- I got a clarification upon the Performance Bonus range, and was told that there is no upper cap on the bonus since it is a flat cut out of the profit that your strategies make, that being said I was told most of the quants end up earning a bonus equivalent to their base pay and even more at times. So just added the target range for community's reference. I don't feel that it is justified to quote the Y1 Comp with the upper range of bonus, it would simply mean inflating the CTC so have not edited the Y1 Comp and have provided the target comp seperately.

title: KrazeApp (AlwaysBlue Pvt Ltd)
content:
**Education: B.Tech (Information Technology)
Years of Experience: 1.3
Prior Experience: TCS(ASE)
Date of the Offer: 15 Nov 2022
Company: KrazeApp
Title : Software Engineer
Location: Banglore
Salary: 12 LPA
Relocation/Signing Bonus: NA
Stock bonus: 2 LPA
Bonus: NA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 14 LPA
Benefits: NA**

## Rounds:
* Profile Screening Round
* Take Home Assignment
* High Level , Low Level Round
* Low Level and CTO Round

### Profile Screening Round:
Resume , Github and Coding profile was reviewed (had to create a profile on a third party site )

### DSA Round:
Have to create a small project that takes zip codes and returns location name and it's latitide and longitude.
Requirements : 
* 1. Preferable Language - Java or NodeJS (but not a strict constraint)
* 2. Follow best practices for writing modular mode.
* 3. Make sure the code is bug free and thread safe.
* 4. Proper exception handling.
* 5. Your code can be easily integrated with a different provider like positionstack.
* 6. Stub the assumptions you’re making with comments supporting the same.
* 7. All functionality should be tested using unit tests to verify behavior.
* 8. Your code should accept an input file and create an output file


### High Level Round:

Have to design a Leaderboard System (High Level) also have to  write the basic structure of Models, Controllers and Services

### Low Level and CTO Round
* 1. Asked to tell High level design of a Notification system and write low level code.

Requirements:
1. Notification can be for different channels and may contain different type of data and metadata 		
1. Code should be written in such a way that in future the third party notification providers can be changed.

* Questions on projects and tech mentioned in resume.

#### Status : Selected
#### Compensation : 12 LPA + 2LPA Esops
#### Previous Company : TCS

Years of Experience: **2 years** SDE before MS and **4+ years** research experience during MS (excluding course work)
Company: Rubrik
Title/Level: Software Engineer / G6
Location: Bangalore 
Salary: 44 LPA
Yearly Bonus: 15% = 6 LPA
Stock bonus: 26 LPA (Total 3600 unit for 4 years)
Joing bonus: 4 L
Relocation bonus: 1.5 L
Total comp (CTC): 81.5 L for first year and then 76 L

Other offers:
IBM hyderabad offered 26L for a staff engineer (IO Virtualization engineer) role and IBM Bangalore offered more than what Rubrik Offered for a role of Linux Kernel Engineer.

I decided to go with Rubrik. IBM works are completely OS-related and I am good with OS. But there is no future for core OS-related works in India. The work at Rubrik will be a little bit challenging. But it's good to take challenges in the early stages of my career.
```

```
title: Microsoft | L62 | Hyderabad
content:
* Education: B.Tech (C.S) Tier-3 college
* Years of Experience: 7
* Prior Experience: Large CDN company
* Previous CTC: 37lac (26 base + ~4 bonus + ~7 RSUs)
* Date of the Offer: Dec, 2022
* Company: Microsoft
* Title/Level: L62
* Location: Hyderabad
* Salary: 32 lac
* Relocation/Signing Bonus: 3 lac (relocation)
* Stock bonus: $ 60k (veted over 4 years)
* Bonus: 20% (usualy around 10% is paid)
* Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 47 lac + one time relocation
* Benefits: Standard Microsoft benefits
* Other details: Had no competing offers when I got this offer
 
HR did not want to entertain negotiations. When I said this is barely 25% hike she told due to "current market situation" it is difficult to get approvals. She was not rude but played in a passive-aggressive way. I wanted the brand name so decided to go with it.

Here is my interview experience: https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/2930953/Microsoft-or-L62-or-Hyderabad-or-Dec-2022-or-Offer

EDIT: A week later I got a (considerably better) offer from Google, accepted it. https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/2928781/Google-or-L4-or-Hyderabad
```

```
Revised Compensation

Joining Bonus: 0
CTC First year: 36 lakhs (base) +8 lakhs (ESOPs)
Benefits: Standard Rippling Benefits

Interview Process:
Round 1: https://leetcode.com/problems/student-attendance-record-ii/
How many possible types of attendence of a student is possible for n days.
Given a student can be present, absent and late on a day.
The student can't be absent for more than 1 day total. And he can't be late for 3 consecutive days.

Input: 
n=1
output:
3
Explaination:
1. L (late)
2. A (absent)
3. P (present)

Input:
n=2
output:
8
AA is not possible as he can't be late for more than 1 day.
Solved using 3 methods
1. Brute force
2. TC : O(n)
3. Gave psuedo solution for O(log n) solution
* Log n solution: Computing for n=2^i
* For example you can compute for n=1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32 etc
* To compute for n=2^i you need to have information about n=2^(i-1). You need to have how many possible count of n=2^(i-1) ends with 0,1 and 2 consecutive 'L' start and 0,1 and 2 consecutive 'L' end and also about how many of then have 0 and 1 absentes
* So n=2^i can be computed from n=2^(i-1) by using 16 steps((3+3)x2 first 3 comes from  0,1 and 2 consecutive 'L' start next 3 comes from  0,1 and 2 consecutive 'L' end and 2 comes from (0 or 1 absent)) 
* Finally for n=5, you can use computations done for n=4 and n=1
* Similarly for n=10 use computations done for n=8 and n=2. 
* Thus the main step is combining.

Round 2:
The questions asked were
1. https://leetcode.com/problems/count-of-smaller-numbers-after-self/
2. Another question was based on binary search and greedy algorithm

title: Infosys | Specialist Programmer
content:
* **Education**: Btech CSE from Tier 3 college , 2023 passout
* **Years of Experience**: 0
* **Prior Experience**: Fresher
* **Date of the Offer**: Sep 2022
* **Company**: Infosys
* **Title/Level**: Specialist Programmer 
* **Location**: PAN INDIA
* **Salary**: 9.5 LPA
* **Relocation**/**Signing** **Bonus**: 0
* **Stock bonus**: No stocks :(
* **Benefits**: Basic Infosys Perks

**Interview Experience :--------)**

I was appear in HackWithInfy 2022, It is an all india coding competition organize by Infosys. I have secured Under 100th Rank in it and got a Pre-Placement Interview Opportunity for the role of Specialist programmer role at Infosys And I also moved into Grand Finale which was organized in Infosys Pune Development Centre on 25 aug 2022 - 29 aug 2022.

# HackWithInfy Round 1:  
There were 3 Question of Problem solving and 3 language were allowed to solve these 3 problems C++, Java, Python.

**Questions 1**: It was an **Easy** question brute force were working on that questions **similar to coin change problem.**
**Questions 2**: It was an **Medium** Question based on Greedy algorithm. 
**Questions 3** : It was an **Hard** Questions based on Dynamic Programming..

# HackwithInfy Round 2: 
It was an Video interview with an interviewer on skype. duration of that interview was 1 hour. 
First of all she asked me to introduce myself and from my interview where i mention I am good in Problem solving and Data structues and algorithms He asked one coding questions.
**Coding Question** : Given Two string, You have to make both the string equal by deleting exactly one character from either of the sting in minimum steps. in one step you can delete one character from either string.

**This questions is on leetcode**: https://leetcode.com/problems/delete-operation-for-two-strings/

After coding questions then he moved on theory part. 
**she asked me Oops Questions :**
1. Abstraction
2. Inheritence, types of inheritence, Multiple and Multilevel inheritence

**She asked me Dbms:**
1. What is indexing
2. What is views
3. What is acid properties
4. Difference between where and  having clause
5. What is trigger

Then she asked my project which i have mentioned in my resume just basic.

***Please Upvote if found Helpful ::)***

title: Indeed | SDE2 | Hyderabad, India
content:
Education: BTech CSE (One of the top IITs)
Previous Company: SDE2 in one of the product firms
Years of Experience: 2 yrs 3 months
Previous Comp: 28 LPA (21 base + some bonus + RSUs)

Company: Indeed
Title/Level: L2 (SDE2 equivalent)
Location: Permanent WFH (Hyderabad office)
Salary: 36.5 LPA
Signing Bonus: 18L with a clawback of 1 year
Stock bonus: 58 lakhs worth RSUs vested over 4 years (vesting schedule 25% after first year, 6.25% per quarter thereafter)
Bonus: Target bonus 15% (ranges from 10-20% of base)
Total comp: 74L (1st year)
Benefits: Standard Indeed benefits like permanent WFH, 10K per month WFH benefit and internet reimbursement, etc

Other offers - Had a couple of offers from Amazon Dublin (downleveled to L4), one lesser-known HFT/hedge fund and a few other offers from startups.

I'll share the interview experience a little later...but all in all it was super smooth and their process really tests out all the facets of an SWE job. I was lucky enough that I got the written offer just before they announced a hiring freeze...phew!

Verdict: Accepted this offer since it was highest of the ones that I got and WFH is a really sweet benefit.

Edit: Here's the interview experience (https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/2801203/Indeed-or-SDE2-or-Hyderabad-or-October-2022-Accepted)

**P.S. Do check out the Phase 2 DSA question related to most frequent k elements in m lists...that is an excellent question.**
```

```
title: Amazon | SDE1 | Bangalore
content:
Education: B.E. in Computer Engineering from Tier 3 College
Years of Experience: 2
Prior Experience: Software Developer at Amdocs, Pune
Prior CTC: 870,000
Date of the Offer: October 2022
Company: Amazon
Title/Level: Software Development Engineer I
Location: Bangalore
Salary: Rs 2,200,000
Relocation: One Time (Rs 150,000)
Bonus: 1st Year (Rs 900,000) and 2nd Year (Rs 750,000)
Stock bonus: 200 Stock vested over 4 years (1st Year - 5%, 2nd Year - 10%, 3rd Year 1st Half - 20%, 3rd Year 2nd Half - 20%, 4th Year 1st Half - 20% and 4th Year 2nd Half - 20%). Stock amount may vary. When I joined stock was around $130. So total compensation for stock will be 130 x 200 x 80 = Rs 2,080,000
Other Bonus: No bonus, no gifts. If you perform good you will be promoted to SDE 2 within 2 years of joining.
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): Total CTC (2,200,000 + 150,000 + 900,000 + 750,000 + 2,080,000 = Rs 6,080,000) 1st Year (2,200,000 + 150,000 + 900,000 + 104,000 = Rs 3,354,000) 2nd Year (2,200,000 + 750,000 + 312,000 = Rs 3,262,000)
Benefits: 15 paid vacation days + 12 paid sick leave days + 12 paid casual leave days + 10 paid optional leave days. Other standard benefits.
Offer Status: Accepted and Joined
Competitive Offer: 1,700,000 + 150,000 (Joining Bonus)
```

```
title: Glance | SD3 | Bangalore
content:
Had 3 rounds of interview. I had specifically asked to be considered for SD3 given my prior experience in full stack dev + building teams and systems from scratch.

Round 1 - LC easy/medium
Round 2 - LC easy/medium
Round 3 - LLD+HLD+HM (they combined these to 1 round, earlier it was supposed to be 2 separate rounds.

title: Microsoft | SDE-2 (L61) | Hyderabad
content:
Education: B.Tech CSE (Tier - 1)
Years of Experience: 3.5
Company: Microsoft
Title/Level: SDE-2 (L61)
Location: Hyderabad
Benefits: Standard Microsoft Benefits

### Initial Offer

Date of the Offer: September '22
Salary: 30 LPA (Including PF)
Bonus: 3 LPA (0-20 %, assuming 10% average)
Stock bonus: 100,000 USD over 4 years (25% vested each year) ~20.6 LPA / year
Signing Bonus: 8 LPA (6 + 2)
Relocation: 4.2 LPA (1.2 + 3)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~63.8 LPA Year-1, ~55.6 LPA Year-2, ~53.6 LPA Year-3 onwards.

**Competing offer**: [Atlassian P4](https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/2669576/Atlassian-or-SDE-2-or-Bangalore)

### Revised Offer

Date of the Offer: October '22
Salary: 32 LPA (Including PF)
Bonus: 3.2 LPA (0-20 %, assuming 10% average)
Stock bonus: 140,000 USD over 4 years (25% vested each year) ~28.78 LPA / year
Signing Bonus: 10 LPA (8 + 2)
Relocation: 4.25 LPA (1.25 + 3)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~76.2 LPA Year-1, ~66 LPA Year-2, ~64 LPA Year-3 onwards.

**Other details**: 
* Despite what I read about Microsoft offers, my experience with them has been very pleasant.
* I did not push them during negotiation, I just informed that I hold another offer with a considerable difference.
* My interviews went well. It could be a factor for the good numbers, but I want to acknowledge how everyone from the recruiter to the Hiring Manager were always helpful and let me consider my options.
salaryTotal: : ~63.8 Lpa Year-1, ~55.6 Lpa Year-2, ~53.6 Lpa Year-3 Onwards.

Team and location wise the pay varies in the organisation. great place to work overall I would say.

title: Expedia | SDE-2 | Bengaluru
content:
* Education: B.E. (Computer) from Tier-3 College in India
* Years of Experience: 3 (Total with 2 in Software Development)
* Prior Experience: Investment Bank
* Current CTC: 18LPA
* Date of the Offer: July 2022
* Company: Expedia Group
* Title/Level: Software Development Engineer II
* Location: Bengaluru
* Salary: ₹28,00,000 
* Relocation/Signing Bonus: ₹4,00,000 (1st year) + ₹2,00,000 (2nd year) 
* Stock bonus: 25k USD (~₹20,60,000 over 4 years)
* Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ₹37,15,000 (1st year)
* Benefits: Standard Expedia Benefits

My initial offer was less but I negotiated all 3 components (base, bonus & stocks) based on the compensation I saw here for SDE-II roles (big thanks to this community for the help!). Their initial offer will always be based on your current CTC but demand based on market standards and their offer range for similar roles. I had counter offers from small scale startups but I didn't have to show them for the negotiation because the interviews went well and they were keen on hiring. 

<u>[Interview Experience](https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/2690980/Expedia-or-SDE-2-or-Bengaluru-or-July-2022-Offer)
```

```
title: Cred | SDE-1 | Bangalore
content:
* Education: Tier 3 College (2022 passout)
* Years of Experience: 10 months internship in MNC + 3 Months FTE in another MNC
* Date of the Offer: Sept 2022
* Company: Cred
* Title/Level: SDE-1 Backend
* Location: Bangalore
* Fixed Salary: Rs 22 Lakhs CTC
* Signing Bonus: Rs 2 Lakhs
* Relocation: Relocation was on Cred (Flight tickets along with family + 15days accomodation in 5* hotel)
* Stock bonus: Rs 28 Lakhs ESOPs vested over 4 years (10% + 20% + 30% + 40%)
* Bonus: Company has no bonus strategy
* Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 26.8 Lakhs
* Benefits: Advanced Salary, i.e., before even joining you get your first month salary, and that follows each month + Laptop will be urs once u leave the company + Standard company benefits

My Fixed was pretty much same as that of previous organisation. They were providing a lot of ESOPs and on top of that the role was great. I have never worked in the Backend. Always worked in the Frontend mostly.

So, was happy to get the offer and moved forward.

**Kindly Upvote if it helps you**
```

title: Amazon | SDET2 | Bangalore
content:
* Education: Bsc  Computer Technology
* Years of Experience: 8
* Date of the Offer: Aug 2022
* Company:  AWS
* Title/Level: SDET 2
* Location: Bangalore, India
* Base Salary: 48.5LPA 
* Signing Bonus: 
	* 1st year: 27LPA
	* 2nd Yeadr: 20.5LPA
* Stock bonus: 650 units vested over 4 years
* Vesting cycle: 5/15/40/40
* Relocation: 1.5L
* Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 
	* Year 1 (48.5L + 27L + 3.5L) = 79LPA
	* Year 2 (48.5L + 20.5L + 10.5L) = 79LPA

**Interview process:**
There were 5 rounds in total:
* Round 1 : Phone Interview (Basic problem solving)
* Round 2: Algorithms and datastructures + Amazon leadership principle (2 coding problems)
* Round 3: Algorithms/datastructures and problem solving (2 coding problems) + Amazon leadership principle
* Round 4: Framework design + Amazon leadership principle
* Round 5: Bar raiser (Behavioural + Amazon leadership principle)

The rounds can be conduncted in any order based on interviewer's availability. For coding problems, we need to provide the optimized solution along with time and space complexity.

title: 3.5LPA to 36LPA Journey | DevOps/SRE
content:
Education: Tier 3 - CSE (2020)
Total Years of Experience: 2 years+ 

Sharing my Journey from ***3.5LPA to 36LPA+*** in last 1.5 years.

**1.** Feb 2021: SAAS based org in Pune. (Started with 12.5k stipend as DevOps Intern in same org)
* Salary: 3.5 LPA
* Duration: 1 year 

**2.** Switched to small E-commerce startup in Mar 2021
*  Salary: 7 LPA fixed
* Duration: 8 months

**3.** Oct 2021: Switched to US based Fintech startup
* Salary: 20 LPA fixed + other bonus
* Duration: 1 year

***Sharing the details of the recent job hunt and the offers received.***

--------------

```
Company: Nike 
Title/Level: Senior Software Engineer
Location: Bangalore (No Remote option)
Salary: 30 LPA fixed
Other Bonus: 6L Joining Bonus 
Total comp: 36 LPA
Benifits: 40% flat employee discount + various benifits
Verdict: Rejected
```

```
Company:  FlexCar (part of zipCar)
Title/Level: DevOps Engineer - II
Location: Bangalore (Hybrid. No remote option)
Salary: 32 LPA fixed
Other Bonus: 4L Joining Bonus  + ESOPs
Total comp: 36 LPA
Benifits: Standard
Verdict: Rejected
```

```
Company: Dyte
Title/Level: DevOps Engineer
Location: Remote
Salary: 30 LPA fixed + good amount of ESOPs
Other Bonus: None
Total comp: 30 LPA
Benifits: Standard 
Verdict: Rejected
```

```
Company: Groww
Title/Level: DevOps Engineer
Location: Remote for now
Salary: 28 LPA fixed
Other Bonus: None
Total comp: 28 LPA
Benifits: Standard
Verdict: Rejected
Reason: After 4 technical rounds I was being told that you are fairly out of our budget and this is maximum we can offer. Utter waste of time. Had to reject it in HR round. Sharing Groww experience because I was willing to join but it turned out to be a nightmare. Told them not to send offer letter.
```

I have accepted a better offer(after considering various factors) as DRE-II (DevOps & Reliability Engineer) at one of the leading org in Gaming space. Apologies, but won't be able to reveal the offer as of now since I have recently joined. Will update it after few months.

**Journey summary:**
Got rejected from dozens of companies but never backed down. Had to reject few offers that were in last stage(HR/HM rounds) because I got what I wanted. Also messed up in 2 HM/HR rounds initially because of nervousness and got 3 rejections for being "out of budget" after completing all rounds.

There is a lot to achieve and learn but sharing one rule that I follow.
***Devote 2hrs/day apart from office to your personal growth/learnings, no matter what. As they say, 9-5 earns you a livelihood but 5-9 makes you stand out from the crowd. `***

My coding skills are not that strong and I acknowledge it. Have started woking on it in previous few months and will keep grinding.

Edit 1: Thankyou for such a positive response. It means a lot.  
Forever Grateful to the community.

```
Location: Remote for now
Salary: 28 LPA fixed
Other Bonus: None
Total comp: 28 LPA
Benifits: Standard
Verdict: Rejected
Reason: After 4 technical rounds I was being told that you are fairly out of our budget and this is maximum we can offer. Utter waste of time. Had to reject it in HR round. Sharing Groww experience because I was willing to join but it turned out to be a nightmare. Told them not to send offer letter.
```

I have accepted a better offer(after considering various factors) as DRE-II (DevOps & Reliability Engineer) at one of the leading org in Gaming space. Apologies, but won't be able to reveal the offer as of now since I have recently joined. Will update it after few months.

**Journey summary:**
Got rejected from dozens of companies but never backed down. Had to reject few offers that were in last stage(HR/HM rounds) because I got what I wanted. Also messed up in 2 HM/HR rounds initially because of nervousness and got 3 rejections for being "out of budget" after completing all rounds.

There is a lot to achieve and learn but sharing one rule that I follow.
***Devote 2hrs/day apart from office to your personal growth/learnings, no matter what. As they say, 9-5 earns you a livelihood but 5-9 makes you stand out from the crowd. `***

My coding skills are not that strong and I acknowledge it. Have started woking on it in previous few months and will keep grinding.

Edit 1: Thankyou for such a positive response. It means a lot.  
Forever Grateful to the community.

title: BNY Mellon | SDE | Pune | Fresher | off-campus
content:
**After 2 months summer Intern at this company, I got PPO.**
**Education:** B.Tech CSE from SRM Insititute of Science and Technology (2023 grad)
**Date of the Offer:** August 2022.
**Company:** BNY Mellon
**Title:** Software developer
**Location:** Pune,India
**Base:** INR 17,00,000.
**Joining Bonus:** INR 3,00,000.
**Relocation:** INR 50,000.
**Retirals (PF/Gratituity):** 1,14,000.
**Total CTC: INR 21,64,308.**
Yearly Bonus/Incentive: Is not part of the above CTC and is paid over and above the mentioned compensation. - **This is around 10-20% of fixed pay so 2-3 lakhs. So overall you can say its ctc is 25 lakhs around** 
**Benefits:** Benefits like medical insurance for self and family upto 6 lakhs, free travel,free food, free internet bills, cool swags like tshirt, boat earphones, powerbank, bottle,mug are over and above the said CTC. - **I got cashless experience for medical costs for my mother's operation which costed 1.4lakhs, it was all paid bny even when I was just a summer intern**.
**Process:** 2 Online assesment, 2 Interviews through BNY Mellon code divas challenege on hackerearth


 * It's a great company they are not inflating their ctc at all, they have not even added variable bonus in the ctc which every comapny does. They are giving almost everything inhand cash its base pay is even more or same as many big product companies like adobe, amazon. 
* Work culture is amazing, not much work pressure and very helpful seniors and manager.

title: Amazon | SDE 1 | 1 YOE | July 2022 | Bangalore
content:
**Education**: B.Tech IT from Tier 3
**Years of Experience**: 1
**Prior Experience**: Reputed product based company
**Date of the Offer**: July 2022
**Company**: Amazon
**Title/Level**: Software Development Engineer (SDE) I
**Location**: Bangalore
**Current Base**: ~INR 17,00,000
**Offered Base**: INR 25,00,000
**First Year Joining Bonus**: INR 5,00,000
**Second Year Joining Bonus**: INR 3,75,000
**Relocation**: N/A
**Stock bonus**: 150 Amazon RSU (5-15-40-40)
**First Year Total** (Base + JB + 5% stock): ~ INR 31,00,000
**CTC** (Base + JB1 + JB2 + 100% stock): ~INR 45,00,000
**Benefits** (In additional to CTC): Standard Amazon Benefits - Meal voucher (INR 1100 per month) + transport allowance (INR 4000 per month) + internet reimbursement (INR 1250 per month).
**Other Offers**: None

**Remarks**:
- Above is negotiated offer, initial offer was ~27,00,000 first year
- My interviews had gone very well, so I was confident in negotiating
- Before offering this salary, I was asked my expected salary over email. I had shared quite high figures there in hopes of pushing the HR to offer me his best. However, the initial offer was lower than what I wanted to settle for.
- The negotiation went on for long and in the end the HR said that they can not do better than 28,00,000. I expressed my dissatifaction and asked them to proceed with the offer if nothing better is possible. However I mentioned that I will "consider" this offer and did not ensure an outright acceptance. I believe this pushed the HR to reconsider and they came back in some time with the above offer.

**Interview Experience**: [Amazon | SDE 1 | Bangalore | July 2022](https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/2407702/Amazon-or-SDE-1-or-Bangalore-or-July-2022-or-Offer)

Cheers

title: Cloudera | 2022 Grad | SWE-1
content:
Education: B.Tech CSE Tier 3 college
Years of Experience: 1 Year Internship at Product based MNC

Date of the Offer: April 2022
Company: Cloudera
Title/Level: SWE-1
Location: Bangalore, India
Salary: 15,00,000 INR (Base)
Empolyer PF : 72,000
RSUs : 500 units vested over 4 years
Variable Pay (5% of Base): INR 75,000 (Quaterly)
Relocation Bonus: 1 Lakh
Transportation + Education Benifits + Internet : 4 Lakhs
Total comp (Base + PF/Gratuity + Bonus + Stock/year): ~27 LPA
Benefits : Standard Cloudera benefits

It was not a good offer at all. As in the job-description they said they will provide a base of 16,00,000. But I was so nerd in negotiating I told them, "You can give me whatever you want." All my friends actually got more, and all the NCG's also got more.
They even provide competitive offers against Microsoft. See: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/2257085/Microsoft-or-SDE-2-or-L61-or-Hyderabad

Even, a friend of mine who worked at Amazon, they provided them a much higher offer.

**Note**: Please do say a good standard number when the HR asks about negotiation else they will play with you.
yoe: 1 Year Internship At Product Based Mnc
